title: Beyond the basics with Elasticsearch
summary:
Beyond the basics with Elasticsearch

Elasticsearch has many use cases, some of them fairly obvious and widely
used, like plain searching through documents or analytics. In this talk
I would like to go through some of the more advanced scenarios we have
seen in the wild. Some examples of what we will cover:

Trend detection - how you can use the aggregation framework to go beyond
simple "counting" and make use of the full-text properties of
Elasticsearch. Percolator - percolator is reversed search and many
people use it as such to drive alerts or "stored search" functionality
for their website, let's look at how we can use it to detect languages,
geo locations or drive live search. If we end up with some time to spare
we can explore some other ideas about how we can utilize the features of
a search engine to drive non-trivial data analysis.
